name: Benjamin L. Cardin
content:
The American Rescue Plan is investing in our hard-hit small businesses to ensure they can safely reopen and stay open. The plan:

o Allocated $15 billion in flexible grants to help the smallest, most severely impacted businesses persevere through the pandemic.

o Bolstered the Paycheck Protection Program with an additional $7.25 billion in funding to support small businesses and non-profits that were previously excluded, such as businesses owned by women, veterans, and minorities.

o Launched the Restaurant Revitalization Fund to provide $28 billion in relief to restaurants and other hard-hit food establishments — bars, bakeries, food stands, food trucks, caterers – to help businesses get grants to cover payroll, rent, utilities, and supplies.

More than 186,200 eligible businesses have applied for support through the new Restaurant Revitalization Fund in two days, illustrating the ongoing need for creative measures like those in the American Rescue Plan.

I’m proud to have worked, and to continue working, on behalf of Maryland’s small businesses to help find ways the federal government can help them forge a path through the pandemic.
